question.questionB: Fruit  with  pappus;  usually perennials; corolla spurred or saccate; stamen one.

question.questionA: Corolla with a long tube, pink, distinctly two-lipped, lobes of the upper lip with ciliate margins, those of  the lower lip red at the base; stamens two.
question.questionB: Corolla tiny, regularly four- or five-lobed; stamens three.

question.questionA: Leaves pinnatifid; calyx teeth long and curved, wooly-haired; fruit veryhairy.
question.questionB: Leaves ovate, crenulate towards the base; calyx teeth short and erect, slightly hairy; fruit slightly hairy.

question.questionA: Perennials, corolla deep pink, strongly zygomorphic, with two lips, the upper with one lobe and the lower with four, spur long.
question.questionB: Annuals; corolla pale pink, lobes actinomorphic, spur very short.
